section.heading: Custom, Usage, and Practice in the Louisiana House of Representatives

content.p: & 399) 31. On motion to direct committee to report, the House does not direct committee how to report, merely that the committee report. (See, Rule 6.13) 32. Third conferee is appointed to insure that opponents have voice on conference. (See, Rule 6.14) 33. House recognizes motion to adopt or reject or return or table on conference committee reports. (See, Mason’s section 766) 34. The House will not notice or consider a conference report signed by fewer than 2 House members or 2 Senators (See, Mason’s section 658) 35. The House does not recognize the motion to reject as a valid substitute to the motion to adopt a conference report. The sole effect of such a motion would be to wrest closing from the author or sponsor. (See, Rule 8.27(B)) 36. Committee chairs exercise discretion as to the order in which to consider instruments listed on the agenda. (See, Rules 14.2(5), 14.25(4), and 14.30(A)) Mason's Manual: Sec. 39
